page.title: 15THE VILLAGE BUTCHER
page.content: The butcher's shop has been there since 1910. Mr. Errett has been a butcher for 35 years and has been in Peaslake for 22 years. The shop is open at 9 a.m. each day except Friday when it opens at 9.30 a.m. It closes at 12.30 on Monday and Saturday, at 5 p.m. on Thursday and Friday and at 4 p.m. on Wednesday. Mr. Errett has one van. Beef and lamb come from Brighton and pork from Horsham. Chickens are bought locally. All this is delivered to the shop. Mr. Errett cuts up all the meat himself. He has one helper. He sells beef, pork, lamb, chicken and sausages. He sells more beef than anything else. Each week he sells ten sheep, two pigs and thirty chickens. Most of his customers come from Peaslake. Mr. Errett sells meat to some schools.
